name: 1.1 - Approved JMF for Asphalt Base or Wearing Course
Detail of Activity / Test - As Per DN1210-WSP-GCO-0160
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Before Works commence
Inspection / Test method - Confirm requirements are followed
Acceptance Criteria - JMF Validated in accordance with NZTA M/10:2020
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Mix Design Report
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - JMF expiry date and validation details in here
Detail of Activity / Test - Weather suitable, Site extents marked, surface suitable for paving (Depths/milling/cleanup complete etc), Environmental Controls in place
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Before Works commence
Inspection / Test method - Confirm requirements are followed
Acceptance Criteria - Weather conditions and Site is suitable for paving
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Site Diary
Detail of Activity / Test - Communication with affected parties
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Minimum of 7 days Before Works commence
Acceptance Criteria - Notify RC at least 7 days before surfacing is programmed
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Communication
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - only required where existing traffic loops are present
Detail of Activity / Test - Paving Plan to be completed
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Before Works commence
Inspection / Test method - NZTA M10: 2020 Clause 9.5.1
Acceptance Criteria - Paving Plan to be completed for each shift with dimensions, location and type of (hot/cold) joints, areas and tonneages
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - String Sheet
Detail of Activity / Test - Mixing of aggregates and bitumen
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Constant monitoring of temperature by calibrated euipment
Inspection / Test method - Plant temperature probes
Acceptance Criteria - PNZTA M10: 2020 states max. 185 deg.C
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Plant site diary
Detail of Activity / Test - Particle Size Distribution
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - 1 per 200t at asphalt plant
○ Refer to Table 5.3 (Refer to CWP for image)
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ accredited test cert
Detail of Activity / Test - Binder Content
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - 1 per 200t at asphalt plant
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ accredited test cert
Detail of Activity / Test - Max. Specific Gravity (MSG) of mix
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - 1 per 600t at asphalt plant
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ accredited test cert
Detail of Activity / Test - Air Voids at lab design compaction
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - 1 per 600t at asphalt plant
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ accredited test cert
Detail of Activity / Test - Application of Membrane Seal
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Per Lot
Acceptance Criteria - Application rate, chip type and binder as per membrane seal design
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Sealing Records
Detail of Activity / Test - Asphalt Delivery temperature
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Every Load on delivery to the Paver Hopper
Acceptance Criteria - Target ≥ 150 deg.C. in the Paver
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Site Diary
Detail of Activity / Test - Compaction Temperature
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - During compaction
Inspection / Test method - Temperature Probe/Infrared gauge
Acceptance Criteria - ≥ 125°C at commencement of compaction.
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Site diary
Detail of Activity / Test - Load Locate
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Each load
Acceptance Criteria - Each load can be indentified to a location using a diagram. Record includes:
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Paving Run Sheet
Detail of Activity / Test - Thickness Monitoring
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Continuously
Detail of Activity / Test - Compaction - NDM
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Plateau to be completed on 1st run, thereafter monitor compaction/roller passes to achieve target density.
Inspection / Test method - Insitu density and air voids
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - Use a calibrated NDM with established core correlation. Locate and mark cores, record NDM Bulk density by core location (including any offset used).
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Minimum of 1 mats and 1 joint
Inspection / Test method - Insitu density and air voids
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ accredited test cert.
Project Specific Notes / Instructions - A pavement lot shall be an essentially homogeneous section of work completed within a shift of production.

○ The lot shall be divided into an appropriate number of approximately equal sub-lots and a core shall be taken randomly within each sub-lot. The Engineer or their delegate shall use a random method for locating each core position, such as ASTM D5361 or a similar process.
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Average of 3 measurements per core
Acceptance Criteria - Average Thickness > Specified Depth (Nominal)
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - IANZ accredited test cert.
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Continuously

Acceptance Criteria - Where the length of the site or the geometry is such that a road roughness-measuring vehicle cannot be used then the straight edge can be used for checking the surface shape. Refer NZTA M/10: 2020 - section 9.8.
○ Not more than 5mm under a 3m Straight Edge.
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Straight Edge Record
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Per Site
Inspection / Test method - As Built Survey
○ Where there is Kerb and Channel shall be flush with or no more than 5mm above the LOC.
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Survey As builts
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Per Site
Inspection / Test method - As Built Survey
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Survey As builts
Detail of Activity / Test - Site clear and cleanup
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - Each Site/Shift
Acceptance Criteria - Site is cleared of plant (or parked in safe location) cleanup of all waste mix, paper and detritus is complete
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - Site Diary
4.1 - Assessment of all test results for conformity
Detail of Activity / Test - Review against ITP Requirements
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - For each site on the project
Acceptance Criteria - Reporting of any non-conforming results to Engineer via NCR
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - NCR
Detail of Activity / Test - RAMM surfacing pavement data spreadsheet updated
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production) - For each site on the project
Acceptance Criteria - Over milled and Deep lift extents recorded and verified by Contract Engineer / QA
○ Spray sheets for membrane area received by Contract Engineer from Sealing Team.
○ Surfacing layer extents recorded and verified by Contract Engineer.
Record documents (QCP - Quality Control Portal) - RAMM Spreadsheet
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
